name: Jay & Silent Bob Do "Degrassi"-"Goin Down-Road" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who played the school principal in the Kevin Smith movie within this episode?
questions.explanation:
Alanis Morissette.

	Alanis Morissette had been in "Dogma" which was written and directed by Kevin Smith. When he got to write and act in "Degrassi: The Next Generation" and pick some of the cast of guest appearances, he chose her again to play a key part. Morissette was the principal in the movie, "Jay and Silent Bob Go Canadian, Eh", that was being made during Smith's appearance on the show.

questions.text: What was the name of of Caitlin Ryan's old show?
questions.explanation:
Ryan's Planet.

	Ryan was played by Stacie Mistysyn and in the real world was Kevin Smith's favorite "Degrassi" character. In the confines of the show, Smith was also a fan of hers. In the previous episode he made reference to her show, and in this one he mentioned it by name and then pulled out a DVD box set of the show. The show she made in modern time within the show was called "Local Heroes".

questions.text: Kevin Smith cast actual Degrassi Community School students in his movie.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Within the show, Smith did in fact cast members of school. Most of the primary cast of the show was in the movie. The movie, "Jay & Silent Bob Go Canadian, Eh!" was a fictional sequel to Smith's movies starring himself and Jason Mewes as Jay and Silent Bob.

questions.text: Craig Manning went missing after his girlfriend left for England.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Craig, who was bi-polar, stopped taking his medicine and ran away from home. He took his guitar and not much else and left. This was after his dad told him he could go to England for the summer, but Ashley told him that she didn't want him to follow her. She told him that she needed space and to get away from him for awhile.

Caitlin.

	Caitlin quit her job after her editor changed the piece she turned in about Kevin Smith. She ended up at the bar with Kevin Smith, and got very drunk. The version of Kevin Smith in the show was single, and she started hitting on him, despite being in a relationship herself. After leaving the bar she went home and proposed to her boyfriend. In the real world Smith was married when they made the show.

questions.text: Who worked at The Dot restaurant, and didn't get along with Craig?
questions.explanation:
Spinner.

	Spinner was a fellow classmate who had gotten into trouble earlier in the season. Spinner and Craig had argued with each other on set when Craig realized that he was doing craft services. They made up a bit when Craig started hiding in the school to write his music.

questions.text: Joey found Craig in the school's boiler room.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Spinner notified Joey that Craig was hiding in the school. Joey showed up to rescue Craig, and brought him home for a bit before Craig ran off a second time. Joey and Caitlin fought about both Craig and her having quit her job earlier in the episode.

questions.text: What interrupted the dance in the fake Kevin Smith movie?
questions.explanation:
Ninjas.

	Kevin was dancing with Caitlin Ryan, and Jay was dancing with his Freshman girlfriend when the ninjas attacked the dance. The scene was interrupted when Joey walked in and announced he was looking for Craig.

questions.text: Kevin references which sport, in which he'd be filming a scene?
questions.explanation:
Football.

	While he was talking to Cailin he asked if she wanted to hang around and watch them film the big football scene. They talked for awhile and eventually he tried to kiss her, but was interrupted by J.T. telling him that he was needed on set. Kevin told Caitlin that she shouldn't be settling for anything in her own life because she deserved better. This lead to her breaking up with Joey and moving to Los Angeles.

questions.text: What did Joey do for a living?
questions.explanation:
Car salesman.

	Early in the episode he was talking to Caitlin about selling a large SUV to a man the day before, only to have the man come in that day to buy a second one for his wife. He told her they were $80,000 each. This was to show that he was back on his feet. Earlier in the season he had nearly been homeless before he had started dating Caitlin and moved into her house. It helped to set up that they wouldn't be homeless after Joey and Caitlin broke up.
